revised_title: Thermodynamical Properties of Supraconductivity in Pb, Hg, Sn, Ta, and Nb
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on pure metals Pb, Hg, Sn, Ta, and Nb to determine the equilibrium curve and entropy difference between the supraconductive and normal states. They found that the entropy difference increases continuously with decreasing temperature and passes through a maximum at about half the transition temperature. This research provides insights into the thermodynamical properties of supraconductivity and the electronic entropy in the normal state of metals.
